Common Stock - Consumer Electronics and Technology Services - Market Cap Over 3 Trillion USD - Fortune 500 Company - S&P 500 Component - NASDAQ 100 Component - Dow Jones Industrial Average Component|348=10|349=A|349=B|349=C|349=D|349=E|349=F|349=G|349=H|349=I|349=J|107=Apple Inc. - AAPL - Technology Hardware Storage and Peripherals - GICS Sector: Information Technology - GICS Industry Group: Technology Hardware and Equipment|15=USD|336=REGULAR|625=1|58=COMPREHENSIVE SECURITY DEFINITION FOR APPLE INC COMMON STOCK: This security represents ownership in Apple Inc., a multinational technology company headquartered in Cupertino, California. The company designs, manufactures, and markets smartphones, personal computers, tablets, wearables, and accessories worldwide. It also sells various related services including digital content, cloud services, and payment services. The security trades on the NASDAQ Global Select Market under the ticker symbol AAPL. TRADING CHARACTERISTICS: The security exhibits high liquidity with average daily trading volume exceeding 50 million shares and tight bid-ask spreads typically under 1 cent during regular trading hours. Market makers and designated market makers provide continuous two-sided quotes ensuring orderly markets. The security supports various order types including market orders, limit orders, stop orders, stop-limit orders, market-on-close orders, limit-on-close orders, and sophisticated algorithmic order types. TRADING SESSIONS: Regular trading hours are 09:30 to 16:00 Eastern Time. Pre-market trading is available from 04:00 to 09:30 with potentially wider spreads and lower liquidity. After-hours trading extends from 16:00 to 20:00. Extended hours trading may experience higher volatility and price discovery differences from regular session prices. SETTLEMENT AND CLEARING: Trades settle on a T+2 basis through the Depository Trust Company (DTC). The security is eligible for continuous net settlement (CNS) and is fully dematerialized with electronic book-entry transfer. MARGIN AND LEVERAGE: The security is marginable under Regulation T with standard initial margin requirement of 50% and maintenance margin of 25% for long positions. Portfolio margin is available for eligible accounts with potentially lower requirements based on risk-based calculations. The security is approved for short selling with standard locate requirements. CORPORATE ACTIONS: The company has a history of paying quarterly dividends, typically declared in late January, April, July, and October with ex-dividend dates approximately one month later. Historical stock splits include 4-for-1 split in August 2020 and 7-for-1 split in June 2014. All corporate actions are processed according to standard market conventions with appropriate adjustments to derivative contracts. DERIVATIVES AND RELATED INSTRUMENTS: Listed options are available through the Options Clearing Corporation (OCC) with multiple expiration cycles including weekly, monthly, and quarterly expirations. Strike prices are available in $2.50 increments near the money and $5 or $10 increments further out. Options contracts represent 100 shares of underlying stock. LEAPS (Long-term Equity AnticiPation Securities) are available with expirations up to 3 years. The security is also the underlying for various ETFs, structured products, and over-the-counter derivatives. INDEX MEMBERSHIP: The security is a constituent of major market indices including S&P 500 (with significant weight due to market capitalization), NASDAQ-100, Dow Jones Industrial Average (price-weighted component), MSCI USA Index, Russell 1000 Growth Index, and numerous sector-specific and thematic indices. Index rebalancing events may impact trading volume and price. MARKET DATA: Real-time Level 1 market data includes best bid, best offer, last sale price, and cumulative volume. Level 2 market data provides full depth of book with all price levels and market maker identifications. Time and sales data provides tick-by-tick transaction history. Historical data is available for backtesting and analysis. Market data is distributed through multiple feeds including CTA/CQS consolidated tape, NASDAQ TotalView-ITCH, and proprietary broker feeds. REGULATORY FRAMEWORK: The security is registered under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 and subject to SEC reporting requirements including quarterly 10-Q filings, annual 10-K filings, and current 8-K reports for material events. The company is subject to Regulation FD (Fair Disclosure) and Regulation G regarding non-GAAP financial measures. Insider trading is monitored and reported through Form 4 filings. The security is subject to circuit breaker rules including market-wide circuit breakers at 7%, 13%, and 20% declines and individual stock trading pauses under LULD (Limit Up-Limit Down) rules. RISK FACTORS: Investment in this security involves various risks including market risk, sector-specific technology risks, competitive risks, regulatory risks, foreign exchange risks from international operations, supply chain risks, intellectual property risks, and key person risks. Historical volatility metrics indicate annualized volatility typically in the 20-40% range. Beta relative to S&P 500 is typically near 1.2 indicating higher systematic risk than the broad market. INSTITUTIONAL OWNERSHIP: The security has substantial institutional ownership exceeding 60% of shares outstanding. Major institutional holders include index funds, actively managed mutual funds, pension funds, sovereign wealth funds, and hedge funds. Institutional trading activity significantly influences price discovery and liquidity. ANALYST COVERAGE: The security is widely covered by equity research analysts from major investment banks and independent research firms. Consensus estimates are available for revenue, earnings, and other financial metrics. Analyst ratings range from strong buy to hold with price targets updated regularly based on company performance and market conditions. SHAREHOLDER INFORMATION: The company maintains an active investor relations program with quarterly earnings calls, annual shareholder meetings, and participation in investor conferences. The company has an active share repurchase program authorized by the board of directors. Detailed financial information and corporate governance documents are available through the company's investor relations website. TECHNICAL INFRASTRUCTURE: Trading is conducted through electronic order routing systems with connectivity via FIX protocol, proprietary APIs, and direct market access (DMA) arrangements. Co-location services are available at exchange data centers for latency-sensitive trading strategies. The security supports various execution algorithms including VWAP, TWAP, implementation shortfall, and liquidity-seeking algorithms.|354=2850||827=1|561=100|562=1|711=3|311=UNDERLYING_SECURITY_ID_001|312=UNDERLYING_SYMBOL_SPY|309=UNDERLYING_ID_SOURCE_1|305=7|462=2|463=USA|311=UNDERLYING_SECURITY_ID_002|312=UNDERLYING_SYMBOL_QQQ|309=UNDERLYING_ID_SOURCE_1|305=8|462=2|463=USA|311=UNDERLYING_SECURITY_ID_003|312=UNDERLYING_SYMBOL_IWM|309=UNDERLYING_ID_SOURCE_1|305=9|462=2|463=USA|555=2|600=RELATED_SYMBOL_AAPL_OPTIONS|601=RELATED_SECURITY_ID_AAPL_OPT|603=RELATED_EXCHANGE_CBOE|608=CFI_CODE_OPASXC|609=SECURITY_TYPE_OPTION|610=20261231|611=175.00|612=C|623=1|624=1|556=USD|600=RELATED_SYMBOL_AAPL_FUTURES|601=RELATED_SECURITY_ID_AAPL_FUT|603=RELATED_EXCHANGE_CME|608=CFI_CODE_FFAXSX|609=SECURITY_TYPE_FUTURE|610=20260321|623=2|624=1|556=USD|864=2|865=1|866=20260121|867=09:30:00|868=16:00:00|865=2|866=20260121|867=04:00:00|868=09:30:00|10=999|
